text: Job’s Discourse on Wisdom
“Indeed, there is a mine for silver
and a place ⸤for gold to be refined⸥.\f + \fr 28:1 \ft Literally “for the gold they refine” \f*
Iron is taken from dust,
and he pours out copper \add from\add* ore.
He puts an end to darkness,
and he searches out the farthest limits
\add for the\add* ore \add in\add* gloom and deep shadow.
He breaks open a mine shaft ⸤away from where people dwell⸥;\f + \fr 28:4 \ft Literally “from with dwelling” \f*
\add those\add* who are forgotten ⸤by travelers⸥,\f + \fr 28:4 \ft Literally “by feet” \f*
they dangle, they sway \add far away\add* from human beings.
\add As for the\add* earth, from it comes food,\f + \fr 28:5 \ft Or “bread” \f*
but\f + \fr 28:5 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* underneath it, it is turned up as \add by\add* fire.
Its stones \add are the\add* place of sapphire,
and \add the\add* earthen dirt ⸤has⸥\f + \fr 28:6 \ft Literally “for it” \f* gold.
“\add It is\add* a path a bird of prey does not know
and \add the\add* black kite’s eye has not seen.
⸤Proud wild animals⸥\f + \fr 28:8 \ft Literally “The sons of pride” \f* have not trodden it;
\add the\add* lion in its prime has not prowled over it.
He puts his hand on the hard rock;
he overturns mountains by \add the\add* roots.
He cuts out tunnels in the rocks,
and his eye sees every treasure.
He dams up rivers from \add their\add* sources,
and he brings secret things to \add the\add* light.
“But\f + \fr 28:12 \ft Hebrew “And” \f* from where will wisdom be found?
And ⸤where in the world⸥\f + \fr 28:12 \ft Literally “where this” \f* \add is the\add* place of understanding?
A human being does not know its proper value,
and it is not found in \add the\add* land of the living.
The deep says, ‘It \add is\add* not in me,’
and \add the\add* sea says, ‘It is not with me.’
“Refined gold cannot be gotten in its place,
and silver cannot be weighed out \add as\add* its price.
It cannot be bought for the gold of Ophir,
for precious onyx or\f + \fr 28:16 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* sapphire.
Gold and glass cannot be compared with it,
and its substitution \add cannot be\add* an ornament of refined gold.
Black corals and crystal will not be mentioned,
and wisdom’s price \add is\add* more than red corals.
The topaz of Cush cannot be compared with it;
it cannot be bought for pure gold.
Indeed,\f + \fr 28:20 \ft Hebrew “And” \f* from where does wisdom come?
And ⸤where in the world⸥\f + \fr 28:20 \ft Literally “where this” \f* \add is the\add* place of understanding?
It is hidden from \add the\add* eyes of all living,
and it is concealed from \add the\add* birds of the heaven.
Abaddon and Death say,
‘We heard its rumor with our ears.’
“God understands its way,
and he knows its place,
for he himself\f + \fr 28:24 \ft Emphatic personal pronoun \f* looks to \add the\add* end of the earth;
he sees under all the heaven.
⸤When he gave⸥\f + \fr 28:25 \ft Literally “To give” \f* weight to the wind
and he apportioned \add the\add* waters by measure,
⸤when he made⸥\f + \fr 28:26 \ft Literally “at his making” \f* a rule for the rain
and a way for \add the\add* thunder’s lightning bolt,
then he saw it and talked about it;
he established it, and moreover, he explored it.
And to the human beings he said,
‘Look, the fear of the Lord \add is\add* wisdom,
and to depart from evil \add is\add* understanding.’ ”
